bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James Edward Yates, the son of Benjamin and Mary Yates, was born in Culpeper County, Virginia on January 24, 1826. By 1860, Yates was living in Rappahannock County, Virginia, where he worked as a cattle dealer. He married Mary Elizabeth Moore in Rappahnnock County on March 19, 1868. The marriage record notes that Yates, a widower, was working as a cattle trader. A 50-year-old J. E. Yates is listed as a stock dealer living in Flint Hill (Rappahannock County), Virginia in the 1880 census. Among others in the household is Yates's wife, Betty; children Charlie, Edward M. and Lizzie; and Yates's mother-in-law, Betsy Moore. James E. Yates died on January 21, 1918 and is buried in Rappahannock County's Flint Hill Methodist Cemetery. (Mrs. A. A. Yates (1829-1867), also buried in this cemetery, was likely Yates's first wife, as a stock dealer named James Yates married Adaline Amanda Swain in Rappahannock county in 1859; in the 1880 census, Harriett Swain, Yates's mother-in-law, is listed among the inhabitants of his household.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of an account book maintained by James E. Yates, a livestock trader in Rappahannock County, Virginia during the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Included are names of customers, as well as dates, descriptions, and amounts of transactions, largely relating to sales of cattle and other livestock. Also included is a file containing loose documents that had been loosely inserted in the ledger. Among these are account statements, receipts, checks, promissory notes, and business correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by item type, with unbound financial documents preceding the account book.
